concept.title: Set a new default JRE for test projects in

conbody.p: uses the default embedded Java Runtime Environment (JRE) v8 to run a instance and compile test projects. You can learn more about JRE v8 in the Oracle document here: JRE v8.

From version 7.9.0 onwards, you can set your desired JRE package as the default one to compile and run test projects. You can also override the default configuration in console mode by using the environment variable.

ul.li: This change applies to the JRE used to run your test projects, not the JRE used to run .

conbody.p:
This guide takes you through the steps to:
Set a new default JRE for a instance.
Apply the new JRE to a test project.
Run tests with another JRE in the command line.
